items.title: Saudi Development Bank raises gaming, tech funds to $239m
items.summary:
- The Social Development Bank (SDB) has increased its financing for the e-gaming and e-sports sector to 458 million riyal (US$122.12 million), a 53% increase from the previous 300 million riyal (US$79.9 million).
- This increase supports the National Gaming and Esports Strategy, with over 30 projects funded including esports clubs, game development, and gaming centers.
- Recent financings include 45 million riyal (US$12 million) for Lobah Digital and 25 million riyal (US$6.66 million) for Virtual Reality Solutions.
- SDB has raised its broader technology financing budget to 898 million riyal (US$239.43 million) in collaboration with the National Technology Development Program.
- Partnerships include collaboration with Microsoft for cloud and AI advancements using Azure, and an agreement with Informatica for improved data management.

items.title: India’s top-funded tech companies in the last decade
Coda Payments names new chief commercial officer
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Coda Payments has appointed Zac Liew as its new chief commercial officer, effective immediately.
- Liew was the co-founder and CEO of Curlec, bringing significant experience to Coda Payments.
- He is expected to drive growth and global expansion for the company, known for its work in commerce, payments, and distribution across various markets.

items.title: Stablecoin firm Plasma secures $20m series A
items.summary:
- Framework Ventures led a US$20 million series A funding round for Plasma, totaling US$24 million in funding.
- The funds will support the development of Plasma's blockchain network designed for Tether’s USDT stablecoin.
- Plasma's network is an EVM-compatible bitcoin sidechain for fee-free USDT transfers and improved transaction efficiency.
- Previously, in October 2024, Plasma raised US$3.5 million led by Bitfinex.
- USDT is the largest USD-pegged stablecoin with a market cap of about US$142.42 billion and the third-largest cryptocurrency overall.

items.title: KKR eyes Nissan equity after Honda talks end: sources
items.summary:
- KKR & Co. is considering an equity or debt investment in Nissan Motor Co.
- This follows the breakdown of merger talks between Nissan and Honda.
- Discussions between KKR and Nissan are in preliminary stages; no decisions have been made yet.
- KKR and Nissan spokespeople have not commented on the discussions.

items.title: Indian communications unicorn Gupshup launches AI agents
items.summary:
- Mumbai-based conversational AI platform Gupshup has introduced a library of 15 customizable AI agents.
- These agents aim to enhance engagement for B2C businesses in sectors like marketing, sales, and customer support.
- They utilize large language models (LLMs) to perform complex tasks and are adaptable across various industries, including BFSI, ecommerce, and travel.
- Recent developments include acquisitions like OneDirect, AskSid, and Active.ai, aimed at enhancing Gupshup’s capabilities in conversational solutions.

items.title: Indian D2C brand Yu Foods sees 103.9% revenue surge in FY24
items.author: Bharat Bhalla, Varun Kapur
items.summary:
- Yu Foods reported a 103.9% revenue increase in FY24, reaching 15.7 crore rupee (US$1.81 million).
- Net losses rose by 80.5% to 11.2 crore rupee (US$1.29 million).
- Total expenses surged 92.86% to 27 crore rupee (US$3.11 million).
- The company sells over 25 instant meal products via ecommerce, quick commerce, and 7,500 retail stores across India.
- Yu Foods raised 55 crore rupee (US$6.5 million) in October 2024 in a series B funding round led by Ashish Kacholia and the Asian Paints Promoter Group.
- For FY25, the company projects revenue of 40 crore rupee (US$4.60 million).

items.title: Saudi launches Web3 Alliance to boost blockchain innovation
items.summary:
- Saudi Arabia has initiated a Web3 Alliance to promote blockchain innovation.
- The alliance aims to foster collaboration among industry stakeholders.
- This move reflects Saudi Arabia's commitment to enhancing its digital economy and positioning itself as a leader in technology.

items.title: Microsoft opens first data center academy in Middle East
items.summary:
- Microsoft Arabia and the National IT Academy launched the first Microsoft Datacenter Academy in the Middle East during the LEAP 2025 conference.
- The academy aims to train the Saudi workforce in skills related to AI and datacenter industries.
- The two-year training program includes datacenter management, IT support, troubleshooting, and advanced technologies such as AI and cybersecurity.
- Graduates will receive certifications to enhance job prospects in technical fields.
- This initiative aligns with Saudi Vision 2030 to develop local talent and strengthen digital infrastructure.
- Microsoft plans to establish three Azure Availability Zones in Saudi Arabia by 2026.

items.title: China trusts AI more than US: survey
items.summary:
- Trust in AI is significantly higher in China (72%) compared to the US (32%).
- India shows the highest trust level at 77%, while Ireland has the lowest at 24%.
- Gender differences are noted, with men (52%) being more trusting than women (46%).
- Younger individuals exhibit greater confidence in AI than older generations.
- Concerns over job losses (58%) and misinformation contribute to declining trust in AI and the tech industry.
- Edelman highlights the importance of transparent communication regarding AI's societal impacts.

items.title: Google ends DEI training, updates AI military policy
items.summary:
- Google has discontinued its Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) training programs.
- The company has revised its artificial intelligence military policy to include stricter guidelines.
- These changes are part of a broader shift in corporate policies towards training and military partnerships.

items.title: Samsung faces tough choice over Stargate AI partnership
items.summary:
- Samsung is considering joining The Stargate Project, a $500 billion AI initiative led by SoftBank, OpenAI, and Oracle.
- A meeting on Feb. 4 in Seoul featured SoftBank's CEO, OpenAI's CEO, and Samsung's Chairman, indicating potential collaboration.
- Samsung's advances in AI chips may position it well for the project, which requires substantial investment amid skepticism over funding and competition from Nvidia and TSMC.
- The initiative aligns with US AI strategy, increasing pressure on Samsung to participate.

items.title: Indonesian SaaS startup Kecilin’s founder missing for 5 days
items.summary:
- Christopher Farrel Millenio Kusuma, founder of Kecilin, has been missing for five days.
- His belongings, including a mobile phone, wallet, black clothing, and several letters, were found at Pandan Payung Beach in Kretek, Bantul.
- The wallet contained Kusuma's ID card, and the letters included messages of apology, details of which are not disclosed due to an ongoing investigation.

items.title: Kakao’s narrows Q4 losses, plans AI service with OpenAI
items.summary:
- Kakao Corp reported a net loss of 276.9 billion won (US$190.1 million) in Q4, compared to 1.91 trillion won (US$1.3 trillion) a year earlier.
- Operating profit fell by 33.7% to 106.7 billion won (US$73 million).
- Revenue from the platform business grew by 10% year-on-year to 1 trillion won.
- Content revenue decreased by 13% to 910.1 billion won (US$630 million), due to declines in gaming, music streaming, and webtoon sales.
- Kakao plans to launch Kanana, an AI service developed in collaboration with OpenAI, later this year.

items.title: Musk, Modi discuss Starlink’s entry into India
items.summary:
- Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Tesla CEO Elon Musk on February 13 in Washington.
- Topics discussed included space, mobility, technology, innovation, and cooperation in emerging technologies.
- Starlink's application for a license to operate in India is currently under review.
- Modi's visit also includes a planned meeting with US President Donald Trump, focusing on trade and tariff issues.

items.title: Dubai delivery app talabat reports strong 2024 growth
items.summary:
- Talabat Holding plc reports its first financials since its IPO in December 2024.
- GMV reached US$7.4 billion in 2024, up 23% from the previous year.
- Revenue grew to US$3 billion, a 32% year-on-year increase, with adjusted EBITDA up 55% to US$497 million.
- Net income surged 64%, reaching US$346 million.
- GCC market GMV rose 20% to US$6.3 billion; non-GCC markets grew 42% to US$1.1 billion.
- Food orders contributed US$5.5 billion with a 16% increase.
- Key drivers included higher consumer demand and a 25% increase in monthly active customers.
- For 2025, talabat anticipates GMV growth of 17-18% and revenue growth of 18-20%.

items.title: HR firm HiBob acquires Mosaic for $35m
items.summary:
- HiBob acquired financial planning and analysis company Mosaic for $35 million.
- The acquisition will integrate Mosaic’s tools into HiBob’s platform for real-time business insights.
- HiBob CEO Ronnie Zehavi emphasized the move towards a unified HR and financial solution.
- HiBob employs 1,300 staff globally, with 70 employees from Mosaic joining the team.

items.title: Coinbase Q4 profit jumps on bitcoin trading surge
items.summary:
- Coinbase reported strong Q4 profits due to increased bitcoin trading.
- Earnings hit US$4.68 per share, surpassing estimates of US$1.81.
- Revenue rose to US$2.3 billion, a significant increase from US$954 million last year.
- Transaction revenue surged by 172% to US$1.6 billion, with subscription income growing by 15% to US$641 million.
- Bitcoin prices exceeded US$100,000, driven by investor optimism over regulatory changes from SEC Chair Paul Atkins.
- Recent developments include Coinbase's plans to return to India and a lawsuit in New York over securities sales.

items.title: Chinese apps return to India after 5 years ban
items.summary:
- After a five-year ban, Chinese apps are returning to the Indian market.
- The Indian government has eased restrictions on specific apps, allowing their re-entry.
- This decision could potentially reshape the competitive landscape of mobile applications in India.

items.title: China’s startup funding, as explained in charts
items.summary:
- The article discusses recent investor activity and shifts in investment trends in China.
- It is divided into two sections: a weekly update of notable investors and companies, and macro trends showing funding distribution.
- Access to the full content and visuals requires a subscription, indicating the article is premium content.

items.title: Car-sharing platform Getaround shuts down US operations
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Getaround is ceasing US operations due to liquidity issues.
- The closure includes the shutdown of its HyreCar business acquired for US$9.45 million in 2023.
- US customers must return rented vehicles by Feb. 12 to maintain insurance coverage.
- Operations will continue in six European countries, including France, Germany, and Norway.
- The company raised over US$750 million in funding, including a US$300 million round from SoftBank in 2018.
- Went public via a SPAC merger in 2022 but faced financial difficulties, including delisting warnings and layoffs.
- An “orderly wind-down” of US operations was approved on Feb. 7, with most layoffs scheduled by Feb. 14.
- Shutdown costs are estimated between US$1.5 million and US$2 million.

items.title: Ex-DeepMind scientist launches biotech AI startup with $50m
items.author: Simon Kohl
items.summary:
- Latent Labs, a biotech startup founded by Simon Kohl, has launched with $50 million in funding.
- The company aims to develop generative AI models for optimizing and designing proteins for drug discovery and synthetic biology.
- Funding includes $10 million seed round and $40 million series A round, co-led by Radical Ventures and Sofinnova Partners.
- The startup is based in London and San Francisco and has a team of about 15 employees.
- Latent Labs will collaborate with biotech and pharmaceutical companies, focusing on AI models and project partnerships.

items.title: AI chip startup EnCharge nets $100m series B
items.summary:
- EnCharge AI has raised over US$100 million in a series B funding round.
- The investment was led by Tiger Global, with participation from Samsung Electronics’ venture capital and HH-CTBC.
- The startup focuses on in-memory analog chips aimed at energy-efficient AI inference.

items.title: EV battery firm Epsilon to invest $1.8b in India’s Karnataka
items.summary:
- Epsilon, an EV battery manufacturer, announces an investment of $1.8 billion in Karnataka, India.
- The investment is aimed at boosting the local production of electric vehicle batteries.
- This move aligns with India's push towards electric mobility and renewable energy technologies.

items.title: AI demand boosts Taiwan’s ASE $1.6b revenue forecast
items.summary:
- ASE Technology Holding Co expects revenue of $1.6 billion from advanced packaging and testing in 2024.
- This is up from $600 million in 2024 and $250 million in 2023.
- Growth is attributed to rising AI technology adoption and its use in edge devices.
- Advanced packaging technology like CoWoS is highlighted, particularly for Nvidia’s AI chips.

items.title: Apple to restore TikTok to US app store
items.summary:
- Apple Inc. will restore TikTok on the US App Store on Feb. 13.
- This decision follows a letter from US Attorney General Pam Bondi.
- TikTok was previously removed from platforms to comply with legislation.
- A Jan. 20 executive order from former President Trump paused enforcement of the law for 75 days.

items.title: Weekly funding: UAE-based Tabby raises $160m
items.author: Queena Wadyanti, Charmaine de Lazo
items.summary:
- Tabby, a UAE-based startup, raised $160 million in its latest funding round.
- The article provides a weekly list of startup funding activities in Asia.
- Access to full details requires a subscription to Tech in Asia.
- Readers can inquire about funding rounds or track active investors through Tech in Asia.

items.title: TreeDots sees strong 2023 revenue growth powering into 2024
items.author: Tylor Jong, Nicholas Lim, Lau Jiacai
items.summary:
- TreeDots, a Singapore startup aimed at reducing food waste, reported a 53% year-on-year revenue growth in 2023.
- The company's losses decreased by 29% during the same period, despite still being unprofitable.
- Co-founder Tylor Jong anticipates revenue could increase by 60% in 2024 compared to 2023.
- TreeDots connects suppliers with excess food to businesses, offering a key cold chain logistics service.
- The company made US$3.3 million from freight transport services, a 152% increase, while marketplace sales rose 45% to US$28 million.
- Growth in revenue is particularly attributed to operations in Indonesia, which saw increased sales of protein-related products.

items.title: QuickBytes: Real talk on Indonesia’s real-time payments scene
items.author: Gavin Tan
items.summary:
- The article discusses the evolution of real-time payments in Southeast Asia, particularly in Indonesia, highlighting the convenience for consumers and the complexities for businesses.
- Brick, founded in 2020 and led by CEO Gavin Tan, aims to simplify the payment landscape for enterprises by unifying payment methods and offering a single API integration.
- Key developments in Indonesia's payment infrastructure include the launch of BI Fast and QRIS, which provide new payment rails while maintaining traditional methods like credit cards and bank transfers.

items.title: Indian state officials to resolve Samsung worker dispute
items.summary:
- State officials in Tamil Nadu are working to resolve a labor dispute at Samsung’s factory in Sriperumbudur, near Chennai.
- Approximately 500 workers have been on a sit-in protest for nine days over the suspension of three employees.
- Tamil Nadu’s Labour Minister C.V. Ganesan stated that normal operations are expected to resume within two to three days.
- Samsung termed the sit-in as an 'illegal strike' and claims production has not been affected as most employees continue to work.

items.title: Trump hints at further delay for US TikTok ban
items.summary:
- President Trump announced a potential delay in enforcing a ban on TikTok on Feb. 13.
- Discussion included extending the current 75-day delay while negotiating a deal for the app's continuation.
- Recent developments include TikTok's removal from smart TVs and the doubling of its GMV in the US market to $33.2 billion.

items.title: Google’s India public policy head resigns
items.author: Sreenivasa Reddy
items.summary:
- Sreenivasa Reddy, Google India's head of public policy, resigned on Feb. 13, 2025.
- This is the second resignation from this critical role in two years.
- Reddy joined Google in September 2023, during a period of significant antitrust scrutiny.
- Iarla Flynn will temporarily lead public policy efforts for India following Reddy's departure.

items.title: AI legal tech startup Eudia secures $105m in funding
items.summary:
• Eudia, an AI legal software startup, has raised $105 million in funding.
• The funding round was led by General Catalyst, providing $30 million upfront and $75 million contingent on acquisition targets.
• The investment is part of General Catalyst’s $1.5 billion Creation fund promoting AI technology in traditionally slower sectors like legal, accounting, and call centers.
• Eudia’s platform leverages AI to support in-house legal teams with contract parsing, risk assessment, and compliance tasks.

items.title: Humanoid robotics firm Apptronik raises $350m series A
items.summary:
- Apptronik has raised US$350 million in a series A funding round.
- The announcement was made on February 13, co-led by B Capital and Capital Factory, with participation from Google's DeepMind.
- The funding aims to advance AI technologies for bipedal robots and adapt humanoid robots for workplace uses by 2025.

items.title: 50 rising AI startups in Asia
items.summary:
- The article lists AI startups in Asia that have recently raised funding.
- It focuses on companies up to the series E stage.
- Each entry provides key details about their funding rounds.
- The list is part of Tech in Asia’s constantly updated data.

items.title: Chinese AI vision firm Bohr secures ‘millions’ in series A
items.summary:
- Chinese AI firm Bohr raised 'millions' in series A funding.
- Investment led by KGI Financial Holding, with contributions from Minyin VC and Broad Stream Capital.
- Total capital raised exceeds 1 billion yuan (approximately US$136.8 million).
- Bohr developed a deep learning network model outperforming industry standards in manufacturing defect testing.
- Funds will be used to enhance semiconductor testing and improve mass production for consumer electronics.

items.title: China’s Neta Auto EV sales soar by 500% in Indonesia
items.author: Wenjun Huang
items.summary:
- Chinese EV manufacturer Neta Auto reported a 500% increase in orders for 2024 year-on-year.
- The company is committed to maintaining stable vehicle prices despite rising EV taxes in Indonesia.
- Neta Auto showcased its lineup, including the NETA V-II Urban Sport Concept, at the 2025 Indonesia International Motor Show.

items.title: ByteDance ordered to pay $11.3m over code plagiarism
items.summary:
- ByteDance has been ordered to pay approximately 82.67 million yuan (around US$11.3 million) to Meishe Technology for code plagiarism.
- The reused code represented 4% of Meishe’s software.
- This case is one of nine lawsuits from Meishe regarding economic losses.
- Li Liang from ByteDance explained that the issue involved a former Meishe engineer accused of code reuse.

items.title: Grab’s in-app recording feature raises privacy issues
items.summary:
- Grab's audio recording feature, AudioProtect, has been enabled by default, raising privacy concerns among users.
- A survey revealed that 90% of users did not recall receiving notifications about the feature's activation.
- The feature is designed for user safety during rides and was part of a trial that concluded on May 28.
- Initially opt-in since March 2023, it became opt-out in November 2024, prompting criticism about notification adequacy.
- Grab updated its notification system on February 3 to ensure alerts are sent for every ride with AudioProtect enabled.

items.title: A minister a day keeps the Apple away
items.summary:
- The iPhone 16 is banned in Indonesia due to Apple's failure to comply with local regulations on manufacturing.
- Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita, the Minister of Industry, is holding off on overturning the ban despite Apple proposing a $1 billion investment to resolve the issue.
- The ban is used as leverage by the Indonesian government to push for local investments and manufacturing from Apple, which could bolster Kartasasmita's political standing.

items.title: 20 largest exits in Indonesia
VinFast unveils VF 3 mini-SUV, offers free charging in ID
items.summary:
- VinFast introduced the VF 3 mini-SUV at the Indonesia International Motor Show (IIMS) 2025, offering free charging until March 1, 2028.
- The VF 3 is priced at 227.65 million rupiah (US$13,920) excluding battery; cash incentive of 7.85 million rupiah (US$479.98) for first 1,000 buyers.
- Deliveries start in April 2025; designed for urban commuting with a range of 215 km and fast charging capabilities (10% to 70% in 36 minutes).
- The SUV features a 10-inch touchscreen and a compact design; VinFast plans to expand in Indonesia with an EV assembly plant.

items.title: Delivery Hero to buy back $1b in bonds
items.summary:
- Delivery Hero SE plans to repurchase approximately €1 billion (US$1 billion) in bonds.
- The buyback will be funded by proceeds from Talabat's public listing in December 2024.
- The company aims to redeem convertible bonds due in 2025 and 2026, and up to €350 million for bonds maturing in 2027.
- This move is part of Delivery Hero's strategy to manage its US$3.8 billion debt more effectively.

items.title: SG’s Union Fintech launches blockchain platform
items.summary:
- Union Fintech has launched a new blockchain platform.
- The platform aims to enhance financial services and improve transaction efficiency.
- This launch marks a significant step in the fintech development in Singapore.
- More details about the platform's features and capabilities were highlighted in the announcement.

items.title: Musk may withdraw $97.4b bid if OpenAI turns for-profit
items.summary:
- Elon Musk's bid of $97.4 billion could be withdrawn if OpenAI decides to become a for-profit organization.
- Concerns raised about the shift from non-profit to for-profit could jeopardize initiatives aimed at ensuring AI development benefits humanity.
- Stakeholders in AI believe that the transition might prioritize profit over ethical considerations and public good.

items.title: Foxconn eyes collaboration over acquisition with Nissan
items.summary:
- Foxconn chairman Young Liu stated on Feb. 12 that the company isn't seeking to acquire Nissan but is open to collaboration and may consider taking a stake for partnership support.
- This marks Foxconn's first public confirmation of talks with Nissan, which is exploring new partnerships after ending merger talks with Honda.
- Foxconn, primarily known as Apple's main supplier, is expanding into electric vehicles without plans to become a branded automaker, focusing on design and manufacturing.
- Following Liu's remarks, Nissan shares fell 6% and Foxconn shares dropped 1.1%.

items.title: Sony forecasts $8.7b profit driven by gaming
items.summary:
- Sony raised its full-year profit forecast by 2% to 1.34 trillion yen (US$8.7 billion), citing strong gaming performance.
- Third-quarter operating profit rose 1% to 469.3 billion yen (US$3 billion), driven by growth in games and music.
- Sony’s games unit profit jumped 37%, with PlayStation 5 sales rising to 9.5 million units, while music profits grew from higher streaming revenue.

items.title: Trump nominates crypto-tied officials for key federal roles
items.summary:
- Former President Donald Trump has nominated several officials with ties to the cryptocurrency industry for significant federal positions.
- These nominations are part of his administration's push to establish a favorable regulatory environment for cryptocurrencies.
- The nominees include individuals with experience in blockchain technology and digital assets, signaling a potential shift in government approach towards cryptocurrencies.

items.title: Tencent wins in US copyright infringement
items.summary:
- Tencent won an US$85 million copyright infringement case against Unblock Tech on Feb. 7, 2025.
- The lawsuit involved Tencent subsidiaries accusing Unblock Tech of copying and distributing over 1,500 Tencent-owned shows.
- Tencent has a history of pursuing copyright lawsuits, including against ByteDance for unauthorized use of its content.

items.title: Early ByteDance investor cuts fund target as interest drops
items.summary:
- Source Code Capital, an early investor in ByteDance, has reduced its new US-dollar fund target from $300 million to $150 million due to lower-than-expected interest from investors.
- The firm hasn't launched a major investment vehicle since early 2021, and the new target may still change.
- The adjustment reflects caution in China's tech sector amid regulatory crackdowns and economic challenges, with US-dollar VC funds in China raising only $1.3 billion in 2024 compared to $17.2 billion in 2021.
